intro: Alysicarpus glumaceus var. thothathrii, commonly known as the Thotathrii sida, is a flowering plant native to southern India. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, also known as the legume or pea family. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered leaves. Its flowers are typically pink or purple, and it produces small, hairy pods that contain seeds. This variety is often grown as a forage crop due to its nutritional value for livestock.
